items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 06 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67268-5 The global burden of Metabolic syndrome is incompletely characterized. Here the authors report a systematic review and modelling study showing that global metabolic syndrome prevalence doubled from 2000 to 2023, now affecting 1.54 billion adults (31.0% of women, 25.7% of men), with higher rates in women, urban areas, and high-income countries, with disparities across regions.

items.summary: Nature Communications, Published online: 06 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67340-0 Achieving desired colloidal dispersion and charge transport of FAPbI3 perovskite quantum dots remains challenging. Here, the authors incorporate bis(2-ethylhexyl) phosphate to increase configurational entropy and improve solvent interaction, achieving device efficiency of 18.68% for solar cells.

items.summary: Frustration in spin systems can prevent ordering even at T = 0 , creating quantum spin liquids that have been sought since Anderson‚Äôs pioneering work in 1973 and his influential 1987 paper connecting them to high-temperature superconductivity. Kitaev‚Äôs solvable spin-1/2 models on a honeycomb lattice brought renewed attention to this field, with Jackeli and Khaliullin later revealing how to engineer Kitaev interactions in real materials. This review highlights theoretical and experimental developments in Kitaev spin liquids, emphasizing leading candidate materials and their broad topological properties such as chiral edge modes. Consequently, it provides essential insights for both experimentalists and theorists working on quantum spin liquid problems. [Rev. Mod. Phys. 97, 045003] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Proton jet formation with focused symmetric spatially chirped beams
authors: Eric C. Nelson, Kyle J. Charbonnet, Trevor Reutershan, Haytham H. Effarah, and C. P. J. Barty
items.summary: Three-dimensional particle-in-cell simulations are used to demonstrate the generation of highly collimated, dense proton jets from planar hydrogen targets using shaped, petawatt-class, laser pulses formed via simultaneous spatial and temporal focusing (SSTF). Simulations assume a 30 J, 30 fs laser p‚Ä¶ [Phys. Rev. Research 7, 043247] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

authors: Z. Y. Yu, J. P. Xu, C. J. Zhu, Z. Y. Bai, and Y. P. Yang
items.summary: We investigate the generation of strong antibunching photons/photon pairs in a two-atom cavity QED system leveraging interatomic van der Waals (vdW) interaction. We show that the vdW interaction shifts the energy of double excited state, enabling the suppression of two-photon excitation via destruct‚Ä¶ [Phys. Rev. Research 7, 043248] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

authors: Wenkang Du and Haiping Huang
items.summary: Understanding the neural correlates of consciousness remains a central challenge in neuroscience. In this study, we investigate the relationship between consciousness and neural responsiveness by analyzing intracranial electrocorticography recordings from nonhuman primates across three distinct stat‚Ä¶ [Phys. authors: Matthew Macnaughtan, Zongda Li, Yiqing Xu, Xiaoming Wei, Zhongmin Yang, St√©phane Coen, Miro Erkintalo, and Stuart G. Murdoch
items.summary: We present a regime of cavity soliton (CS) excitation in a Kerr resonator driven by a train of desynchronized pulses. In this regime, the soliton solution is shown to be the sole available state for the intracavity field, allowing for the automatic excitation of single solitons without the applicati‚Ä¶ [Phys. Rev. Research 7, 043250] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Zigzagging diffusion and nonstandard transport in particle-laden nanopores under extreme confinement
authors: Andreas Baer, Paolo Malgaretti, Kevin H√∂llring, Jens Harting, and Ana-Sunƒçana Smith
items.summary: Understanding transport subject to molecular-scale confinement is key to advancing nanofluidics, yet classical hydrodynamic laws often fail at these scales. Here, we study a model system: transport of toluene as a solvent and small fullerenes as model particles confined within alumina slit nanopores‚Ä¶ [Phys. Rev. Research 7, 043251] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Controllable operations of edge states in cross-one-dimensional topological chains
authors: Xian-Liang Lu and Ze-Liang Xiang
items.summary: A scheme is proposed to implement controllable operations on edge states using local interactions in cross-one-dimensional topological emitter chains. It enables robust quantum state transfer and tunable s·¥°·¥Ä·¥ò gates via a double-quench protocol, without requiring global, adiabatic modulations. The dissipative dynamics is investigated for emitters coupled to an environment, where the edge-state qubit can exhibit superradiant and subradiant behavior. [Phys. Rev. Research 7, L042050] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Probing lambda-gravity with Bose-Einstein condensates
authors: Hector A. Fernandez-Melendez, Alexander Belyaev, Vahe Gurzadyan, and Ivette Fuentes
items.summary: A proposal to use a trapped Bose-Einstein condensate to measure two components of the gravitational potential, the Newtonian term, and the contribution from the cosmological constant by exploiting phononic excitations and a tritter operation. The setup allows measurements of Newton‚Äôs constant G with an improvement of 2 orders of magnitude over current measurements, establishes a laboratory-based upper limit on the cosmological constant Œõ, and enables measurement of the distance-dependent behavior of each term in the gravitational potential, providing a means to test modified gravity theories. [Phys. Rev. Research 7, L042051] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Quantum geometry of bosonic Bogoliubov quasiparticles
authors: Isaac Tesfaye and Andr√© Eckardt
items.summary: The quantum geometric characterization of bosonic Bogoliubov-de Gennes systems is developed through the symplectic quantum geometric tensor, which encompasses both the symplectic Berry curvature and a distance-defining symplectic quantum metric. These geometric quantities are directly measurable via integrated excitation rates under periodic parameter modulations, and the symplectic Berry curvature governs anomalous transverse velocity of Bogoliubov wave packets under external forcing. [Phys. Rev. Research 7, L042052] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Two-Mode Bosonic State Tomography with Single-Shot Joint-Parity Measurement of a Trapped Ion
authors: Honggi Jeon, Jiyong Kang, Wonhyeong Choi, Kyunghye Kim, Jaehun You, and Taehyun Kim
items.summary: Measurement of joint phonon parity with spin-dependent beam-splitter interaction enables direct Wigner-function tomography and real-time detection and mitigation of motional heating in a trapped ion. [PRX Quantum 6, 040352] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025

items.title: Quantum Subspace Verification for Error Correction Codes
authors: Junjie Chen, Pei Zeng, Qi Zhao, Xiongfeng Ma, and You Zhou
items.summary: Integrating subspace verification and direct fidelity estimation provides a general tool that can efficiently and robustly verify the fidelity of encoded states. [PRX Quantum 6, 040353] Published Wed Dec 03, 2025
